decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - This permission for the modular mobile theatre unit is for a limited period of 5 years expiring on 31/01/2030 and the building hereby permitted must be removed and the land restored to its former condition by or before that date in accordance with a scheme of works, which shall include details of replacement tree planting within the car park area, to be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
Reason: The building is of a temporary nature and is unsuitable for retention on a permanent basis, to comply with Section 72 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [2111-ST-XX-XX-DR-A-1262 rev. A18; 2111-ST-XX-XX-DR-A-3261 rev. A15; 2111-ST-XX-XX-DR-A-3262 rev. A15; 2111-ST-XX-GF-DR-A-2262 rev. A17; 2111-ST-XX-01-DR-A-2263 rev. A17; 211-ST-XX-RF-DR-A-2264 rev. A16; 2111-ST-XX-XX-DR-A-3266]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 4 - The sub-station hereby approved shall be provided and become operational no later than 1st March 2026, with the temporary mobile theatre unit linked to mains supply with the temporary mobile generators currently serving it removed by that date, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  
Reason:To protect the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the objectives of the National Planning Policy Framework.


Condition : 5 - Within 3 months of the date of this consent a new Travel Plan for the hospital should be submitted to the local planning authority for its written approval. The Travel Plan should  include objectives, targets and measures to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport such as walking, cycling and public transport for any journey associated with the hospital, whether by staff, patients or visitors, along with review and monitoring measures.  
Reason: To encourage sustainable modes of travel in accordance with Council policy LP51 of the Local Plan (adopted July 2023) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Retention of the existing temporary modular mobile theatre unit (for a further 5 years) with the replacement of access ramps to the existing temporary building and introduction of planters; provision of a permanent High Voltage Substation (two transformer units and a backup generator and fuel tank).

application_details.scheme_name: QMH - Retention of Mobile Operating Theatre Unit, access updates and new planters

subdivision_of_building: The proposal comprise the retention of the existing Theatre Unit and access updates (ground floor publicly accessible).
